page.title: 14The Racing Industry
page.content: The{Racing Industry}is very important in this area which lies in the "Golden Triangle" around Newmarket famous for its horsebreeding. Steve Cauthen, rider of the 1985 Derby winner, lives in Stetchworth. There are parts of five studs in our area.Stetchworth Park, Dalham, Derisley Wood, Cheveley Park and Collin.Collin stud, near Stetchworth school, used to breed working horses for the Stetchworth Estate but now, like the others, it breeds thoroughbreds. Formerly called the Aislabie Stud, it has been in existence for 300 years. This area was first used for horses because the boulder clay land was no good for farming.It is now known that minerals in the soil are good for the healthy growth of horses.
